<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 106, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 808, 107]]<|/det|> A radiation detector is used to monitor the radiation from a radioactive source. A rate records the number of counts per minute. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 119, 144, 138]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 119, 880, 153]]<|/det|> The source is brought close to the detector. The table below shows how the ratemeter reading varies with time. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[101, 161, 853, 272]]<|/det|>
time/s020406080100120140160180
ratemeter reading counts/min3002301841421089274605042
count rate due to source counts/min2801648854403022
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 287, 181, 306]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 287, 685, 308]]<|/det|> The bottom row gives the count rate due only to the source. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 319, 403, 338]]<|/det|> Fill in the missing values. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 319, 876, 338]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 349, 181, 368]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 349, 702, 368]]<|/det|> From the table, estimate the half-life of the radioactive source. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[504, 395, 876, 415]]<|/det|>
half-life = ............................................... $s$ <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[868, 395, 878, 415]]<|/det|> [2] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 428, 146, 447]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 875, 463]]<|/det|> Even when the source is a long way from the detector, the ratemeter registers a reading of 20 counts/min. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 473, 484, 494]]<|/det|> Suggest a cause of this 20 counts/min. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[799, 567, 876, 586]]<|/det|> [Total: 4] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 643, 621, 663]]<|/det|> **Question 12 is on the next page.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 107, 94]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 245, 876, 282]]<|/det|>
When a nucleus of \(^{212}_{84}\mathrm{Po}\) decays by emitting an alpha-particle, it becomes a nucleus of lead (Pb).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 293, 522, 312]]<|/det|>
The equation below represents this process.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 319, 567, 345]]<|/det|>
\[^{212}_{84}\mathrm{Po}\rightarrow \mathrm{\hat{X}}_{}^{4}\mathrm{Pb} + \mathrm{\hat{4}}_{}^{4}\mathrm{\alpha}\]

<form>Y = .........................
